snippet: A park designated as the official protest site of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, whose main arenas are about 10 miles away, highlights how the Russian government often smothers dissent under a thick blanket of bureaucracy.
abstract: Small park in Khosta, Russia, about 10 miles from Sochi, has been designated by authorities as official protest zone of the Sochi Winter Olympics; park, however, has been devoid of protests, highlighting how Russian government often smothers dissent under blanket of bureaucracy.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer and Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A park designated as the official protest site of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, whose main arenas are about 10 miles away, highlights how the Russian government often smothers dissent under a thick blanket of bureaucracy.

headline.main: A Russian Protest Zone Where Almost No One Registers a Complaint
headline.print_headline: A Protest Zone Where Almost No One Registers a Complaint
